description.narrative: By 2020, all schools in the targeted areas provide a quality teaching environment, including in emergencies, which contributes to Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: School-age children, particularly girls and those in vulnerable regions, have access to quality basic education, including in emergency situations.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, all schools in the targeted areas provide a quality teaching environment, including in emergencies

description.narrative: Over the reporting period, the Programme equipped 1,058 teachers (526 females) with technical and practical skills to provide psychosocial support (PSS) to learners affected by conflicts. These teachers are providing disaster and risk reduction (C/DRR) and child-centered pedagogy in Littoral and West regions. A total of 102,380 (44,590 girls) children have been reached by these teachers. Programme has also technically supported the Government at strategic and operational levels to develop and pilot a model for quality education delivery for vulnerable children through technology. Programme is also investing to expand possibilities improve on research for teaching and learning | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/06/2020
